msDesc.head: Theological composite manuscript; A) (fols. 1–8) & B) (fols. 9-20) Germany, s. xiii2

physDesc.p: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 238–245. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

binding.p: Limp vellum binding over laminated pulpboard for Abp. Laud, 1637–1639.

history.provenance: Two fascicles, both written in Germany and dating from s. xiii2; bound together latest since the late 1630s.
William Laud, 1573–1645: his ex-libris inscription, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. ii verso.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

msItem.title: Commentary on the Song of Songs (imperfect)
On the seven sacraments
msItem.incipit: Sapientia edificauit sibi domum excidit columpnas .vij. [Prv 9:1] Septem ecclesiastica sacramenta que deus contulit ecclesie in via firmiter sunt credenda.
msItem.explicit: gloriam divinitatis et humanitatis. ihesu christi in quibus homo beatificabitur in corpore in anima’
msItem.note: See Graz, UB, Ms. 856, fol. 165r (without prothema).

msItem.author: Bertold of Regensburg
msItem.title: Sermo dominica 5 post epiphania domini
msItem.explicit: debita sed propter nequiciam eius repetebantur que prius fuerunt dimissa.
msItem.note: Schneyer 1. 473f. 14; see also 7. 258. 171, de s. Matthia.

msItem.title: On giving alms
msItem.incipit: Quatuor sunt in elemosina necessaria primo quod libenter detur. secundo quod de proprio. tertio. quod cito. iiijo quod pauperibus Secundum est restituere plenarie.
msItem.explicit: misericors deus fac pro morte tua sicut marta pro morte fratris et suscitaberis a domino ihesu christo.

msItem.incipit: De omnibus sanctis – Mementote operum patrum vestrorum que fecerunt in generacionibus suis ... magnam. [I] Mach. ij. [51] Ad faciendum omnium sanctorum memoriam. dupliciter prouocamur scilicet per ammonicionem
msItem.explicit: sitis memores operum eorum vt similiter faciatis.
msItem.note: (cf. Martin of Opava, Sermo de s. omnibus sanctis (Schneyer 4. 146. 299))

msItem.incipit: Beati mortui. qui in domino moriuntur. [Apc 14:13] Nota quod quidam moriuntur pro domino quidam in domino. quidam extra dominum. Pro domino. ut martyres. Extra dominum qui extra corpus suum misticum quod est ecclesia moriuntur
msItem.explicit: vt hec illorum vestis cicius candidetur hodie pro eis omnibus fit communis memoria.
msItem.note: Incipit cf. Mainz, Stadtbibl., Hs I 274b, fol. 122r.

msItem.incipit: Coronauit eos dominus corona iustitie. [cao6342] Duplex est corona qua coronat dominus martyres suos. prima glorie quo ad animam in celo. secunda honoris quo ad reliquias corporis et per celebracionem festi eius
msItem.explicit: tale gaudium est angelis de liberacione consororis sue videlicet. fidelis anime.
msItem.note: Incipit cf. Kremsmünster, Stiftsbibl., CC 284, fol. 155r (prothema different).

msItem.incipit: Uirgo cogitat que domini sunt ut sit sancta corpore et spiritu [I Cor 7:34] In hiis verbis apostolus describit veram virginitate [recte: virginitatem] a deuocione cum dicit cogitat. a castitate cum subdit ut fit sancta et cetera
msItem.explicit: in celo virginitati comparari potest. immo in virginitate est angelice virtutis similitudo.
msItem.note: Incipit see Kremsmünster, Stiftsbibl., CC 23, fol. 166r; cf. also Martin of Opava, Sermo de s. Caecilia (Schneyer 4. 147. 310; see also 8. 568. 82 & 9. 620. 35).

msItem.incipit: Ascendam in palmam et apprehendam frvctus eius [Ct 7:9] Nota palma est arbor nobilis angusta inferius. et lata superius. sic anima que vvlt ascendere debet esse gracilis inferius ad omnes terrenas uoluptates et carnales affectus
msItem.explicit: floribus auibusque decorare in presenti vita ut in futuro valeamus regnare cum ipso qui viuit et regnat per secula Amen
msItem.note: Incipit cf. Schneyer 8. 387. 3 and Augsburg, Staats- und Stadtbibl., 2o Cod 420, fol. 123vb

msItem.author: Bertold of Regensburg
msItem.title: Sermo dominica 3/4 adventu domini
msItem.explicit: contra carnem et contra mundum Immo contra omnia nobis miseris aduersancia.
msItem.note: Schneyer 1. 473. 6; see also 8. 637. 18 & 748. 54; 9. 531. 139, the latter two in annuntiatione BMV)

msItem.incipit: Audi filia syon et exulta filia ierusalem. quia Xirios deo laudem. angelis leticiam. hominibus salutem
msItem.explicit: et alii sancti te solam flagitant reparatricem

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Laud Misc. 37 – Part B, fols. 9-20

msItem.author: Stephen Langton
msItem.title: Commentary on the Song of Songs
msItem.note: With prologue (unpr.; – cf. Stegmüller, Bibl. 7809,1 (as Ps.-Stephen Langton) (only the beginning identical) & 1354 (‘Magister Anselmus’), (incorrectly) citing this copy (the present text is different, despite the matching incipit; see also RThAM 16, as quoted below, p. 30, n. 6); A. Wilmart, ‘Le commentaire sur le prophète Nahum attribué à Julien de Tolède’, Bulletin de littérature ecclésiastique (1922) 253–79, at p. 258 n. 2; Glorieux, Rép., 104f2, citing the present MS. (as Stephen Langton); J. Leclercq, ‘Le commentaire du Cantique des cantiques attribué à Anselme de Laon’, RThAM 16 (1949) 29–39, this copy at p. 30, n. 6 (incorrect date); Hauréau, Initia, 3. 130rb, citing the present MS.; the ascription to Stephen Langton after G. Lacombe & B. Smalley, ‘Studies on the commentaries of Cardinal Stephen Langton’, parts i, ii & indices, AHDLMA 5 (1930) 5–220, at pp. 140–44 & 196, this copy at p. 141; and Sharpe, Handlist, 626).

msItem.title: Auctoritates
msItem.incipit: Humilitas est via per quam additus patet in regno celorum hec enim via non deserit. nisi deserentem
msItem.explicit: dolencium. Qvarta .v. significat. vbertatem egencium. quinta. s. significat sanctitatem languencium.
msItem.note: Quoted by name are a ‘philosophus’ (applying to several philosophers), John Chrysostom, Bernard [of Clairvaux], and Augustine.

layoutDesc.layout:
Ruling in a brownish crayon, only on a few leaves visible; one column of (mostly) 29 or 30 and (fol. 20v) 34 lines. Ruled space
142–48 90–92

handDesc.handNote: German textualis cursiva, by two hands.
